name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: In other words, our national security is being guarded by a bunch of doofs you wouldn’t trust to throw your cousin a surprise party.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: No one on the group chat thought to ask, ‘Who is J.G. What are these initials?’ They could have been leaking state secrets to Jeff Goldblum for all they know.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: My God, if Joe Biden’s top military team accidentally texted these plans to a journalist, Laura Ingraham’s erection would be so rock-strong it would break through the wall like the Kool-Aid man.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: ‘If you read the content of these massages?’ The point is, we’re not supposed to read the content of these messages!

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: You hear that, China? Our planes go up to 47 now. It’s Spinal Tap , the administration.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: ‘F-47’ sounds like a vanity plate you’d get if you wanted everybody to know you don’t like Donald Trump.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: I agree with him on this one. It’s not a very good likeness. I mean look how inaccurate the skin color is. The skin is the color of skin.

name: Jon Stewart
monologue: Oopsie-poopsie! You know, back in my day if you were a journalist who wanted leaked war documents, you had to work the sources, meet them in a dark garage, earn the trust, pound the pavement. Now? You just wait for the national security advisor to be distracted by The White Lotus while he’s setting up his ‘bomb Yemen’ group chat.

name: Jon Stewart
monologue: You can’t say words like ‘sex,’ or ‘women,’ or #MeToo? How can a lot of your cabinet members describe their weekends?

name: Jon Stewart
monologue: You can’t protest in a way that offends the right, you can’t teach things that the right doesn’t want you to teach, you can’t read things that they don’t want you to read, you can’t use words that they don’t want you to use, but they love free speech!

name: Jon Stewart
monologue: He’s demanding they take it down because he believes this picture is unflattering. Which really makes you think—do you think other pictures of you are flattering? At least in the painting they blended the foundation into your hairline.

name: Jon Stewart
monologue: Social media is free speech in the same way that Doritos are food.

name: Jon Stewart
monologue: Where are my conspiracy theorists at, now that it’s on the right? For God’s sake, billionaires are designing machines to manipulate our speech to control our behavior and rewire our brains. They’re removing our regular speech and doing a—I don’t know— great replacement of it.

name: Taylor Tomlinson
monologue: This is not helping Pete Hegseth’s reputation as guy who is always drunk.

name: Taylor Tomlinson
monologue: This is a drunk guy mistake. This is the national security equivalent of air-dropping a d*ck pic to everyone in the office.

name: Taylor Tomlinson
monologue: Obviously, this is a huge f*ck up. But don’t worry, the White House has responded saying that from now on, discussions of military operations will be conducted over much more secure lines—Snapchat.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: ‘Non-woke musicals.’ Also known as any musical you take your dad to.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: So… a dog?” on leaked audio of trump regaling the kennedy center board with the time he went to see cats with “somebody i should not have been there with

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: Does he think every song in Cats is called ‘Cats?’ ‘Of course, the showstopper was that famous song about memories—’Cats.'

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: Wow. Man alive, you could have given me a thousand guesses and that would have been all of them.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: Really? Because it really seems like you want to do it. You’re like a guy who brought his guitar to the bonfire.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: Let’s be fair. I can see why he’d be upset, because that looks exactly like him.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: Trump, he’s still mad they don’t want to be the 51st state, so he dispatched Secretary of Homeland Security and Real Housewife of Guantanamo Bay, Kristi Noem.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: That’s pretty ominous. When he decides he wants something, he will not let go. I remember what he said about that French fry that fell under the Resolute Desk.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Seriously, how bad is the price of eggs when even the government needs a sponsor?

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Hey, if people can’t find peace on 4/20 it’s never gonna happen.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Although if there’s two things that don’t go together, it’s 4/20 and deadlines.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Thanks to Amazon, the cake will be sent in 38 separate boxes.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: The company said they were 50 percent sad, 37 percent disappointed, and 13 percent Scottish.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: It’s the worst news to hit the DNA testing business since Maury was cancelled.
